alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 12:39PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS EXPECTED FOR KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... TONIGHT`S THREAT: Persistent west-southwesterly flow today into tonight coinciding with high tide and higher seas could raise water levels 1 to 2 feet above normal highest tide, especially between Newtok and Kipnuk. SATURDAY/ SATURDAY NIGHT`S THREAT: A strong frontal system is then expected to bring southwesterly gale force winds with gusts 35 to 45 mph across the Kuskokwim Delta coast Saturday afternoon through Saturday night. The resulting higher seas and surf coinciding with high tide could raise water levels 2 to 4 feet above normal highest tide, especially between Newtok and Kipnuk. PREPAREDNESS: Residents are encouraged to move items up from the immediate coastline and monitor the forecast water levels for tonight into Saturday night.
